taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family ORCHIDACEAE;subfamily EPIDENDROIDEAE;tribe ARETHUSEAE;genus Hexalectris;species spicata;variety arizonica;

bio:treatment.discussion: This autogamous and florally reduced segregate of Hexalectris spicata has been thought to be of hybrid origin, derived either from H. spicata var. spicata and H. nitida, or less likely from the former taxon and H. revoluta (P. M. Catling and V. S. Engel 1993). In Texas this plant tends to begin flowering later than the typical variety, from June and July (P. M. Catling and V. S. Engel 1993), as it does in Arizona and New Mexico, where it flowers in July and August (R. A. Coleman).

references.reference: Catling, P. M. and V. S. Engel. 1993. Systematics and distribution of Hexalectris spicata var. arizonica (Orchidaceae). Lindleyana 8: 119–125.
